Package au.edu.anu.ymuit.ui.colour

Class ColourContrast

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.anu.ymuit.ui.colour.ColourContrast
  • public class ColourContrast
extends java.lang.Object
    A method of selecting a set of contrasting colours from 3d colour space. The distance between colours is based on perceived difference (cf ColourItem class). 1) Add all javafx named colours to an indexer that are a sufficient distance (3d space) from the background. They need to be from the set of named colours because for css we just use names rather than colours. or Generate 4096 colours (without real names). 2) Divide the 3d space into n volumes and select one colour nearest to the center of each volume. Then select from that list those which have a user supplied difference in luminosity from the given background.

      • getContrastingColours64

        public static java.util.List<javafx.scene.paint.Color> getContrastingColours64​(PaletteSize ps,
                                                                               javafx.scene.paint.Color bkg,
                                                                               double contrast)
        Upto 64 colours from 4096 generated colours. The number will be less than 64 depending on contrast required with background.
        Parameters:
        bkg - background colour
        contrast - (0.0 - 1.0)
        Returns:
        List of Color

      • getContrastingColourNames

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getContrastingColourNames​(PaletteSize ps,
                                                                         javafx.scene.paint.Color bkg,
                                                                         double contrast)
        Creates a list of named colours that contrast with the given background colour and are distant in perceived colour from each other in 3d space. The methods will return up to a maximum of 27 out of approx 148 named colours. The number return depends on the background colour choice and the contrast requested. Use these colour names to set the css style sheet of the scene.node in question.
        Parameters:
        bkg - background colour
        contrast - (0.0 - 1.0)
        Returns:
        Array of Javafx color names for contrasting colours.
